project.teaser: The ever-increasing use of building monitoring and control systems has created an opportunity for data-driven approaches in the entire construction sector. At the same time, interaction and interoperability among data platforms remain a challenging issue. MODERATE will...
project.objective:
The ever-increasing use of building monitoring and control systems has created an opportunity for data-driven approaches in the entire construction sector. At the same time, interaction and interoperability among data platforms remain a challenging issue. MODERATE will formalize a set of procedures and techniques that enable building owners, policymakers, facility managers, utility companies, etc., to openly share their data, gain insights, and make decisions while complying with regulations such as the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). Moreover, MODERATE will enable uniform access to heterogeneous data sources on buildings' performance, usually dispersed in several non-interoperable data silos.
Although several projects have recently emerged to address the problem of defining a modular data architecture, they lack: - A protocol for data sharing and anonymization, complying with the rules defined by the GDPR while avoiding losing the statistical properties that make them valuable. - A solution enabling data owners to openly share their datasets while profiting both economically and in terms of knowledge on their data. - A fully open platform. Commonly, most of the results (data, algorithms, software, etc.) of a project are owned by partners within the consortium, making it very difficult to use them later without their permission.
MODERATE will develop an open platform, embracing leading-edge technologies, such as artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), blockchain/distributed ledger technologies, the internet of things (IoT), and many more. This platform will enable its users to analyze real-time building data from various building systems and provide insight into the many dimensions of a building's performance. The use of synthetic data generation techniques, not yet widely applied in the construction industry, is one of the elements that allow open data sharing, enabling more reliable services and generating business opportunities.
project.title: Marketable Open Data Solutions for Optimized Building-Related Energy Services
project.keywords: Open Data Platform, Data Anonymization and Synthetization, Building Stock Management, Facility Management, Optimization, Building Services

result.title: Report on users' perceptions
result.description: D6.2: Report on users’ perceptions – [M14]This report collects feedback from key stakeholders based on questionnaires and interviews, as inputs for theidentification and first definition of the key features for the MODERATE marketplace.

result.title: MODERATE Platform Architecture
result.description: D2.1 MODERATE Platform Architecture [draft M10, final M24]Report that defines the high-level architectural components, interactions, and technology stack

result.title: Guidelines to investigate users' perceptions about the use of building data
result.description: D6.1: Guidelines to investigate users’ perceptions about the use of building data – [draft M7, final M18]The deliverable describes the guidelines as instructions, methods and templates for demo partners on how to enroll potential users as co-designers and testers of the marketplace.

result.title: Quality control process
result.description: D3.3 Quality control process [M15]Report on the validation process of the dynamic and static building stock data and respective findings plus correc-tions implemented.

result.title: Data Integrity and Validation Pipeline
result.description: D2.3 Data Integrity and Validation Pipeline [draft M14, final M28]Implementation of the horizontal data quality and validation policies adopted in the MODERATE platform.

details.authors: Fabio Giussani; Eric Wilczynski; Claudio Zandonella Callegher; Giovanni Dalle Nogare; Cristian Pozza; Antonio Novelli; Simon Pezzutto

result.title: Static building stock analysis
result.description: D3.2 Static building stock analysis [M12]Dataset and respective report on EU’s building stock in terms of building characteristics, energy consumptionpatterns, and technologies utilized.

result.title: Model techniques for synthetic data creation
result.description: D4.2: Model techniques for synthetic data creation [draft M12, final M19].This deliverable will explain the Machine Learning techniques used to generate synthetic data

result.title: MODERATE analytics for buildings V2.0
result.description: D5.2: MODERATE analytics for buildings V2.0 [M24]This deliverable will define the second version of MODERATE building analytics based on feedbackreceived by industrial partners.

result.title: Data Storage and Analytics Layer Implementation and Documentation
result.description: D2.2 Data Storage and Analytics Layer Implementation and Documentation [draft M13, final M27]Implementation of the data storage services and scalable data analytics platform, including automation scripts andtools for repeatable deployments and documentation that describes the architecture and usage of the data storageservices and scalable data analytics platform

result.title: MODERATE analytics for buildings V3.0
result.description: D5.3: MODERATE analytics for buildings V3.0 [M36]This deliverable defines the final version of building analytics to be implemented in the industrial partners plat-form (WP6).

result.title: Dynamic building stock analysis
result.description: D3.1 Dynamic building stock analysis [M12]Dataset and respective report on the EU building stock obtained by satellite data in terms of building characteris-tics, technologies utilized, and information on energy consumption patterns.

result.title: Comparison of dynamic and static data/information of Europe's building stock
result.description: D3.4 Comparison of dynamic and static data/information of Europe’s building stock [M18] Report on the counterpositioning of the validated dynamic and static data and respective conclusions.

result.title: MODERATE analytics for buildings V1.0
result.description: D5.1: MODERATE analytics for buildings V1.0 [M12]This deliverable will define the firs development of MODERATE building analytics.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - MODERATE (Marketable Open Data Solutions for Optimized Building-Related Energy Services)
result.description: periodic
result.teaser: MODERATE project aims at increase accessibility to heterogeneous data on buildings energy performance, breaking non-interoperable data silos. To this aim, MODERATE outputs innovative methodologies and a web platform that jointly enable building owners, facility managers...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: MODERATE features' fact-sheets
result.description: D6.3: MODERATE features’ factsheets – [draft M18, final M23]Standard factsheet for each of the digital features of the MODERATE marketplace identified in the co-creationworkshops carried out with key stakeholders related to each of the demo cases.

result.title: POR for MODERATE
result.description: D7.1: POR for MODERATE [draft M13, final M28]Report that defines the Programme of requirements of MODERATE platform.

result.title: Management and monetization services
result.description: D5.4: Management and monetization services [M24 draft, final M30]This deliverable describes services used to facilitate data license between producers and consumers using smartcontracts as well as data monetization through tokenization of dataset.

result.title: Trust Mechanisms Implementation and Report
result.description: D2.5 Trust Mechanisms Implementation and Report [draft M17, final M30]Implementation of the innovative trust mechanisms and report that describes the innovative trust mechanisms implemented in the MODERATE platform by leveraging the distributed ledger called IOTA Tangle.

result.title: Data enhancement methods for building stock
result.description: D4.1: Data enhancement methods for building stock [draft M8, final M15].This deliverable will show the methods used to enhance the building stock data using standard ontology and se-mantics.

result.title: Public Interfaces Implementation and Documentation
result.description: D2.4 Public Interfaces Implementation and Documentation [ draft M20, final M29]Implementation of the public interfaces, including the IAM module and documentation of the interfaces that arepublicly exposed to the Internet to support the development of services and applications

result.description: D7.2: MODERATE Lean Model Canvas [draft M6, M15, final M30]Organization of Workshops to validate uses of KER’s, collection of feedback from early adopters and summary of outcomes in a report format.

category.title: internet of things
category.displayCode: /natural sciences/computer and information sciences/internet/internet of things

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
